what's the process of your next show like

2689.text:
getting it? Are you auditioning now, are you
networking? How do you pull out going from

2696.text:
one to the other with not enough like [unintelligible]
down time [unintelligible].

2707.text:
>>John: It's-it's hard in this business to
go from one job to another. I mean it really

2712.text:
is. There-there are few, there are a few people
that do it.

2716.text:
>>John: I'll tell ya I've been at the theater
like three times this week and I swear to

2720.text:
God if I hear one more word about another
audition I'm gonna shoot my brains out.

2723.text:
>>Shina: And I'll say it right out. I had
four this week.

2727.text:
>>Shina: So in between doing shows and now
that we know we're closing our agents are

2730.text:
all working to get us the next job so we're
gonna be auditioning so it's hard to balance

2736.text:
between being so sore I can't move, and still
doing the show and auditioning and giving

2740.text:
like a hundred percent 'cause this is what,
now I need this job.

2744.text:
>>Mikey : Yeah, it's strange too 'cause you
go, you go to an audition in the morning and

2748.text:
it will go well and maybe you get the call
back and you're like all excited and it's

2751.text:
a totally different thing; you're tap dancing
and you're smiling and-and then all of a sudden

2755.text:
you're like, "Oh wait. No. Now I gotta go
be a gang member --

2761.text:
Yeah, it is kind of interesting to balance
it 'cause a lot of times there'll-there'll

2764.text:
be call backs at noon or one or whatever and
you've got a show at 2:30 and you're like,

2769.text:
"I gotta do this really fast, but I gotta
calm down because I gotta be cool." It's a

2773.text:
little tricky but right now there's a lot
of auditionings happening which is nice.

2781.text:
>>commentator: I think we have time for one
more question. Okay.

2793.text:
>>male #4: You all, all of you seem supremely
confident physically; like the way you carry

2797.text:
yourselves and all that. Like you really seem
like performers. Is this something you-you've

2798.text:
had your whole life or did you learn how to
get this. It's just interesting to see especially

2800.text:
because working with programmers they can
be such "julubs".

2804.text:
>>commentator: All see is parallels is drawing
here. This is good.

2806.text:
>>Shina: I think we've all just don't wanna
speak for everyone, I think we've all had

2813.text:
it. That's what like part of the reason I
wanted to be in it; 'cause I've always been

2819.text:
a loud, not attention grabber, but like just
always wanted to, I don't know, do stuff.

2830.text:
>>Mikey : I gotta say that I don't think I
was always that way, but especially doing

2836.text:
this and being on stage every day, sometimes
twice a day, eight times a week, does give

2841.text:
you just this, "Well I'm in front of people
again." You kinda like lose track of all the

2848.text:
wishy washiness and you just, you learn to
be yourself really well I think when you're

2853.text:
constantly performing and constantly on, on
the stage I guess. That's how it's been for

2859.text:
>>John: I was just larger than life. I had
so much energy; so much energy.

2865.text:
>>commentator: Yeah, so I was the stage manager
before.

2867.text:
This is kinda interesting the question as
well. So there's a theater, North Carolina

2870.text:
theater had a theater camp so when we would
do our four prod, main stage productions in

2874.text:
the summer to keep us employed, we'd do this
theater camp for the kids and like all the

2878.text:
stage moms and like, "Well my kid is the best
little kid and is gonna be famous, " and all

2882.text:
So like this is one of the kids that shows
up; and was the problem kid, of course.

2888.text:
But like, I mean programs like that I think
help people kind of discover themselves and-and

2892.text: kind of start them, I don't know. --

2898.text:
>>John: Yeah, I mean it's-it's, over time
it develops. You grow up; you mature; you

2902.text:
find out what your strengths and weaknesses
are and if you just go with what your strengths

2907.text:
and weaknesses are and you know what they
are, you know what I mean? If you really,

2910.text:
really, really know what makes you tick and
what makes you happy, you can do a lot.

2916.text:
It's all about giving something so I can take
somebody out of their world for five seconds

2922.text:
and make them feel something different; make
them feel alive or make them go back to a

2927.text:
time and a place when I sing a song so they
have a memory of their father or their mother,

2931.text:
that maybe wasn't the best memory but all
of a sudden it's good.

2934.text:
Like things like that; it's the magic of-of
theater. And it's the fact that it's live

2940.text:
and you can see and there's an interaction
and there's-there's a realism that's there

2945.text:
>>commentator: And you feel that, you feel
that emotion.

2947.text:
>>John: and a passion and there's a passion
that you can feel.

2948.text:
And I'm all about feeling emotions. If I don't
feel it, I don't want it.

2953.text:
So I mean that's why I do it. And I think
that's where my confidence comes from.

2957.text:
>>commentator: So Shina any last comments
before we wrap it up? Mikey --

2963.text:
>>Shina: I've just always been like a loud
person.

2966.text:
>>Shina: I don't know. I, sometimes I forget
I'm not on stage too. And I'll like be having

2972.text:
a conversation with someone and me, my best
friends are exactly like me too, like really

2975.text:
loud and animated. So I've just always been
like that.

2978.text:
>>Mikey : Yeah, I think once you get into
this business especially like this far in,

2983.text:
you're surrounded with theatrical people so
much that it just never really is over.

2989.text:
>>Mikey : The curtain comes down, but not
really.

2992.text: We're still on stage. Let's be serious.

2995.text:
>>Mikey : We don't mind. We like to be fun,
big, and goofy.

2999.text:
>>commentator: Everybody give 'em a big round
of applause and thank them for coming to Google.

3006.text:
>>commentator: And I'm sure we'll come and
see you see. We have discounts so --
